intro: Secamone macrostachya, commonly known as the large-stemmed secamone, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It produces small, round fruits that contain one or two seeds. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
